Matt Margolis at PJ Media separated out the eight counties of just downstate New York, and he treated that geographically small but densely populated and hard-hit area as if it were a separate nation from the U.S.  And he found that just those eight counties, just the eight counties, would lead the world in confirmed coronavirus cases at over 16,000 cases per million people. If downstate New York were a separate nation, it would rank number one in deaths per million, and the rest of the US would drop to number 11.
